entry.title: All About Rivian - Unveiling Insights Into the Groundbreaking R2S and R2T SUVs
entry.content:
All About Rivian - Unveiling Insights Into the Groundbreaking R2S and R2T SUVs

Rivian, the new American automaker producing “electric adventure vehicles,” is still busy ramping up production on its R1T electric truck and R1S SUV , but they’re also looking ahead to the future. I’m talking about the Rivian R2 platform, which promises to deliver smaller yet highly capable EVs starting at $40,000.

First things first, the Rivian R2 isn’t necessarily a replacement for the R1 series. Instead, it’ll be an all-new platform with different sizing targeting buyers at a lower price point. That said, every automaker is working on making high-end electric vehicles more affordable, and here’s what you need to know.

Rivian R2 Release Date

Tyler Hayes / How-To Geek

With the Rivian R1T still slowly arriving to buyers and other customers taking delivery of the R1S all-electric SUV, which is still far behind production and has thousands of pre-orders that need to be filled, the R2 platform might seem forever away. However, the company isn’t wasting time improving its manufacturing process and technology, cutting costs, and ramping production to release more mass-market vehicles.

Details are still a bit blurry, but Rivian has said its all-new R2 platform will be revealed in 2024, and that production may not begin until sometime in late 2025 or early 2026. But given how fast the industry is moving, I wouldn’t be surprised to see the company fast-track those plans to hit the 2025 launch window.

The bigger question for potential buyers is which model will arrive first, the R2T or R2S? So far, all signs point to a smaller, compact, more affordable R2S that’ll take on Tesla, Chevrolet, and others in the EV space. Rivian CEO R.J. Scaringe recently confirmed that the company is prioritizing production of the R1S over the R1T, as its SUV has a higher demand. That leads us to believe it’ll launch a new R2S SUV first, which could help the company capture more market share and sell additional units.

In fact, during a recent Q&A session on Instagram, which was uploaded to YouTube , the company gave us our first teaser of the R2 platform. As you can see from the photo below, it’s a smaller SUV, which one can assume is the R2S. Overall, it looks similar in design, with that familiar tough and boxy design. It’s not uncommon for manufacturers to add extra trim or body paneling to conceal design elements, so don’t read into it too much.

If all goes according to plan, we could see the new and improved Rivian R2S arrive near the end of 2025, followed by the R2T electric pickup.

Rivian R2T and R2S Pricing

Rivian / YouTube

Rivian teasing its new R2S electric SUV.

As we all know, electric vehicles aren’t all that affordable yet . However, that’s precisely the goal of the new Rivian R2 platform. While the current Rivian R1T starts around $73,000 and the R1S will set you back at least $78,000 (before destination fees ), we’re hearing new R2 models could come in between $40,000 and $60,000. We’re expecting similar trim levels to current offerings, starting with the Adventure Edition, Adventure All-Terrain, and something similar to the high-end Launch Edition.

Over the summer, Rivian CFO Claire McDonough shared a few comments at a Deutsche Bank conference and reaffirmed those price targets, which is certainly promising. If the company can deliver a high-end R2S for close to $40,000, it’ll give Tesla’s Model Y a run for its money.

Forex Robotron Gold Package

Rivian R2 Platform: Potential Specs

Tyler Hayes / How-To Geek

Rivian vehicles are extremely capable both on and off-road. They have luxurious interiors, big infotainment screens with loads of driving and camp modes , and speedy 0–60mph times. Unfortunately, some of those performance numbers and long-range battery packs might suffer in the push for affordability. CEO Scaringe went on record and said the R2 platform would have to make sacrifices, but we’re not sure what those are.

Considering the new Rivian R2 platform is still a work in progress, with an unveiling not expected until sometime in 2024, we don’t have any information on the motor, powertrain, range, charging speeds, or any of the other fancy features of the Rivian R1T . Still, we expect battery advancements, dual electric motors, maybe a tri-motor option, and all-wheel drive configurations. Rivian will likely aim for 300–330 miles of range, give or take a few, depending on the package.

The company recently confirmed its latest in-house designed dual-motor models equipped with the max battery pack get over 400 miles per charge . And while that’s great, expect smaller battery packages on the R2 platform to achieve a lower MSRP. We’ll update this article as more information emerges about the Rivian R2 and its specs.

dotConnect for Oracle is an ADO.NET data provider for Oracle with Entity Framework Support.

Taking on Tesla (And Others)

Rivian

We mentioned the Tesla Model Y earlier, as it’s currently one of the best-selling vehicles in the world. That’s due to an excellent design, user-friendly features, and a somewhat affordable price point . Well, for a luxury electric SUV. However, in the coming months, it’ll have stiff competition from the new Chevrolet Blazer EV, Equinox EV , and the new Rivian R2S, eventually.

If Rivian can scale up production to its goal of 150,000 units or more per year by 2025, all while delivering an affordable Rivian R2 platform, it’ll be well-positioned to take on the electrified competition.

The goal is to lower costs, improve profitability, and provide excellent adventure vehicles for the masses. In closing, Rivian says the R2 platform will help expand its portfolio “globally across different price points and form factors.” suggesting the R2S and R2T are just the first two of many new models.

entry.title: Expanding ChatGPT Capabilities with New Browser Extension Features
entry.content:
Expanding ChatGPT Capabilities with New Browser Extension Features

ChatGPT from OpenAI is an increasingly-popular chatbot, but without knowledge of recent world events, its usefulness has been limited. OpenAI is now introducing plugins for ChatGPT, including some that give ChatGPT access to web data.

ChatGPT doesn’t have the ability to search the internet for information, which is something Microsoft partially addressed with Bing Chat (based on the same OpenAI technology). OpenAI’s solution is a new plugins feature, which allows other developers to create add-ons for ChatGPT that can be turned on or off as needed – many of which connect to web services.

The first wave of third-party plugins work a bit like Amazon Alexa Skills . There’s an Expedia plugin for managing trip plans, an Instacart plugin for ordering from grocery stores, and an OpenTable plugin for restaurant searches. However, OpenAI also has two plugins of its own: a web browser and a code interpreter. The browser plugin can perform web searches and cite sources in answers, exactly like Bing – OpenAI even says it’s using Bing’s search API.

OpenAI

OpenAI said in a blog post, “We’ve created a web browsing plugin which gives a language model access to a web browser, with its design prioritizing both safety and operating as a good citizen of the web. The plugin’s text-based web browser is limited to making GET requests, which reduces (but does not eliminate) certain classes of safety risks. This scopes the browsing plugin to be useful for retrieving information, but excludes “transactional” operations such as form submission which have more surface area for security and safety issues.”

The web browsing functionality seems close to Bing Chat, which is better, but still not great. Bing still isn’t great at sorting through data, or knowing when a source is too out of date to be useful, or other similar problems.

Plugins in ChatGPT are currently limited to “a small number of developers and ChatGPT Plus users,” and they will roll out more widely as some of the bugs are worked out.

Source: OpenAI , TechCrunch

entry.title: Virtual Reality Photography: Revolutionizing Immersive Visual Storytelling
entry.content:
Virtual Reality Photography: Revolutionizing Immersive Visual Storytelling

Quick Links

  • Flatscreen Shooting Isn’t Really Shooting
  • The Satisfaction of VR Firearms
  • The Best VR Shooters
  • VR Shooting Has Room for Improvement

The PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X represent the next generation (well, the current generation if we’re being pedantic), but first-person shooters offer pretty much the same experience as they always have. In VR, things couldn’t be more different.

Flatscreen Shooting Isn’t Really Shooting

When you play an FPS on a console or PC, there’s a disconnect between your in-game character and you. Your role is essential to point the reticule at a target and tell your character when to fire. From that point on your character generally makes sure your rounds land on target. Other aspects of handling your firearm, such as reloading or holstering are all automated in the world of flat screen shooters. There’s nothing about shooting in an FPS that’s anything like actually shooting. It’s essentially a skin for a very different activity.

That’s not to say some developers haven’t tried. Realistic simulation titles such as the ARMA series try to do the best they can with a flat-screen, a mouse , and a keyboard . Still, it doesn’t quite hold together as an experience.

Flat-screen shooters all involve lining up pixels on a 2D plane, whereas shooting is something that happens in 3D space. No matter how powerful your GPU or sophisticated your CPU simulation, there’s a hard limit to how shooting can be represented on a flat monitor or TV .

The Satisfaction of VR Firearms

Shooting in VR games, whether it’s towards the simulator or arcade end of the spectrum, feels like an entirely different type of game than traditional shooters on a console or PC. The weapon is now a 3D object, rather than what’s essentially a picture overlaid in your viewport. It requires something much closer to actual marksmanship to aim at a target and actually hit it.

Aiming down your sights and hitting your target feels far more rewarding in VR than in traditional games. Every round feels like a small individual victory.

Holstering, reloading, modifying, and operating VR firearms is an engaging activity all by itself, even before we get to other game elements.

Any DRM Removal for Win：Remove DRM from Adobe, Kindle, Sony eReader, Kobo, etc, read your ebooks anywhere.

The Best VR Shooters

There are plenty of VR shooters out there, but a few are worth highlighting for their enjoyable gunplay.

The Binary Mill

Gun Club VR (for the Oculus Quest and Steam ) looks and feels a little like a cheap mobile game at first, but it’s actually a title with way more depth than you’d expect. Buying and modifying guns to your style and playing skills-based activities such as marksman challenges fully engage you in the act.

WonderFox DVD Ripper Pro

The Binary Mill

Resident Evil 4 VR (Quest 2 ) is a perfect example of how transformative VR can be for shooters. It takes the classic over-the-shoulder shooter Resident Evil 4 and transforms it into an embodied first-person VR shooter. Desperately fighting off the advancing hordes with your pistol or shotgun puts more excitement into five minutes of gameplay than some flat-screen shooters manage across their entire run.

The Binary Mill

Half-Life Alyx (PC SteamVR ) isn’t just a showcase for what VR games can and should be, it has absolutely stupendous gunplay. Standing in a cold, concrete, dimly-lit basement and fumbling to reload a pistol while a headcrab zombie shuffles towards you is something that never gets old.

There are many honorable mentions as well, including off-beat gun-based VR games such as BONEWORKS , Pistol Whip , or Superhot VR . Onward in particular is a pioneering mil-sim (military simulation) multiplayer shooter that offers a leap over eSports fodder such as Counterstrike.

VR Shooting Has Room for Improvement

While we think that VR shooters offer the most substantial change to how it feels to shoot in a video game, the experience has a few rough spots. The biggest constraint is movement. In flat screen shooters, you can speed around a level by simply pushing your sticks in the right direction, but in VR you can’t physically run around unless you enjoy colliding with things.

Some games, like Half-Life Alyx, are designed with encounters that don’t require fast movement. Rather it relies on slow-paced teleportation. Other games, like Resident Evil 4 VR, let you run around using the right stick on the Touch controller. This type of fast movement can lead to a queasy feeling if you aren’t used to it, so it’s not the most comfortable solution.

PaperScan Professional： PaperScan Scanner Software is a powerful TWAIN & WIA scanning application centered on one idea: making document acquisition an unparalleled easy task for anyone.

The Binary Mill

High-end VR systems like the Omni One make use of omnidirectional treadmills to let players move around as much as they’d like, but these are likely too expensive and impractical in their current form.

Haptics could also be made stronger, to introduce a greater sense of recoil. There’s always the option to have shooter peripherals as well, helping complete the experience. If you enjoy shooting in your next-generation console and are a virtual firearm enthusiast, you owe yourself the chance to experience shooting in VR, especially since there’s never been a better time to pick up a VR headset .
